sentences.en: I dropped my toast, but luckily it fell right side up.
sentences.cn: 我把吐司掉到地上了, 不过幸好它正面朝上.

sentences.en: Luckily a bush broke his fall.
sentences.cn: 幸运的是,他掉下时有灌木挡了一下.

sentences.en: Luckily for me, he spoke very good English.
sentences.cn: 算我幸运，他英语讲得很好。

sentences.en: Luckily he is here and can give you a hand.
sentences.cn: 好在他在这里,可以帮你一把.

sentences.en: Luckily he reminded me. Otherwise I'd have forgotten all about it.
sentences.cn: 亏他提醒了我, 要不我早忘了.

sentences.en: Luckily he was not very seriously wounded.
Luckily I dodged in time, or I'd have been knocked down by the bike.
sentences.cn: 幸亏我让得快, 要不早被那辆自行车撞倒了.

sentences.en: Luckily I was at home when he called.
sentences.cn: 他来看我时,我幸好在家.

sentences.en: Luckily our precious records were saved from the fire.
sentences.cn: 幸运地,我们这些珍贵的记录从火灾中抢救了出来.

sentences.en: Luckily the museum was not damaged by the earthquake.
sentences.cn: 幸好，博物馆没有在地震中遭到破坏。

sentences.en: Luckily, I'd noticed where you left the car.
sentences.cn: 幸运的是我注意到了你把车停在哪里.

sentences.en: Luckily, iron can be reworked and mistakes don't have to be thrown away.
sentences.cn: 所幸的是，铁可以再加工，次品、废品不必被扔掉。

sentences.en: Luckily, my watch was turned over to the property office.
sentences.cn: 很幸运, 有人把我的表交到了失物招领处.

sentences.en: Luckily, Sue is very efficient and does an excellent job as Fred's personal assistant.
sentences.cn: 幸运的是，作为弗雷德的私人助理，休办事效率很高，工作很出色。

words.tran_cn: 运气；幸运；带来好运的东西

trans.tran_en: used to say that it is good that something happened or was done because if it had not, the situation would be unpleasant or difficult
